entry.title: Make ManifestDemuxer::Engine::Seek async
entry.content:
When the ownership model of HlsDataSourceProviderImpl changed to own

everything on the renderer thread and have all interactions with the

network process, the ability to abort pending network requests on seek

was removed. This CL re-adds that ability by making an async

AbortAllPendingReads method on the HlsDataSourceProvider. This of course

requires that The seek method of HlsManifestDemuxerEngine be made

async as well.



Bug: 1266991

Change-Id: Ib2a60c7ef3848b3c8429b4cc403040c01b9c48b7

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4913899

Commit-Queue: Ted (Chromium) Meyer

Reviewed-by: Dale Curtis

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1206189}

entry.title: [Android] Create Public Transit framework
entry.content:
This CL:

- Creates a new instrumentation test framework and checks in the

basic framework-layer Public Transit classes.

- Converts TabSwitcherActionMenuTest to the framework and

checks it in as TabSwitcherActionMenuPTTest as an example of

test-layer code.

- Breaks ground on the transit-layer by creating the classes needed by

TabSwitcherActionMenuPTTest.



Bug: 1489444

Change-Id: I686ee277471e7a4123b3a17c57fa7f2d8c9428ba

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4903374

entry.title: [CloudOpenMetrics] Add MetricState
entry.content:
Add the `MetricState` enum which tracks the state of a given metric.

Update the state in the `Metric::Log()` function.



The state is initialised to `kCorrectlyNotLogged` and becomes

`kCorrectlyLogged` or `kIncorrectlyLoggedMultipleTimes` in

`Metric::Log()`. In the latter case an ERROR is logged.



The other states can be reached later in the `CloudOpenMetrics`

destructor.



Bug: b/300861997

entry.title: Disable unsupported codecs at the ffmpeg level. Add flags.
entry.content:
This prevents compiled in, but reachable codecs from being used;

controlled by a new FFmpegAllowLists base::Feature that is enabled

by default.



This should improve security in cases where external ffmpeg is used

or where we've marked a codec for deprecation using a run time flag

(in preparation for removing it from compile time).



This also adds a default-enabled CrOSLegacyMediaFormats switch

which can be used to turn off support for CrOS codecs.



R=jrummell



Bug: 992235, 1489034

Change-Id: I69928a40f86ed65d726da7d7b8efbc1d4db08d99

entry.title: [CloudOpenMetrics] Add template Metric class
entry.content:
Introduce a template `Metric` class which logs a value of the generic

`MetricType`. It also stores the value so it can be used later.



Since several metrics with different `MetricType`s will be

logged/recorded by `CloudOpenMetrics`, this is a convenient way to

reduce repeated code.



`CloudOpenMetrics` creates each `Metric` object by passing in the unique

`metric_name_`.

entry.title: Fix compile of C++ classes auto-generated from packed mojo structs.
entry.content:
Consider the following mojo struct:



```

struct Foo {

bool a@0;

[MinVersion=1] bool? b@1;

[MinVersion=2] bool? c@2;

}

```



Compilation will fail due to a duplicate constructor as the auto-generated C++ class looks like:



```

class Foo {

public:

Foo();

explicit Foo(bool a);

Foo(bool a, absl::optional b, absl::optional c);

Foo(bool a, absl::optional b, absl::optional c);

};

```



The duplicate constructor appears to be due to miscounting the number of

constructor parameters for some versions of the struct when there are

optional scalars present.



This CL attempts to fix counting of constructor parameters by using

the per version field count in the unpacked struct rather than the

packed struct which was previously cached in `version.num_fields`. Now, `version.num_fields` will contain unpacked field count while

`version.num_packed_fields` will contain packed field count.



Bug: b:303437510

Change-Id: I24de332631b54d723dbeaa30b9357d75d34192b0

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4913434

entry.content:
Currently, signals are passed as an array of pairs from the

cpp to the ts code. This CL changes it to a struct.



This is in preparation for a followup CL that will add an 'ml

calculator' where the user can manually tweak signals and view the ml

score. That will require communicating signals back from ts to cpp code.

Using pairs to do so would have a high risk of typos and

extra places we'd have to keep the consistent when

adding/renaming/removing signals.



Refactor only; no user behavior change.

entry.title: Fix dangling pointer in DlpScopedFileAccessDelegate
entry.content:
This CL changes the delegate so that it fetches the dlp client

every time it is needed. It also adds a check to ensure that the client

is both available and alive. This avoids holding onto the global

address in the delegate class.



This also adds an indirection for fetching the the global singleton.

This should make it much easier to swap between the real impl and the

fake impl during tests without changing the runtime behaviour.

entry.title: Reapply: Enable SafeBrowsingSkipSubResources in fieldtrial_testing_config
entry.content:
This reverts commit fb2b68593d2aa510997efc35a3cdd0f017eb1070.



Original commit: https://crrev.com/c/4914016

Revert: https://crrev.com/c/4914016



Reason for revert: Wrong variable used in a test that caused the test

to fail when the feature is disabled so the test passed locally and

in the trybots that run before submission but failed on a bot that

ignores the fieldtrial_testing_config.

See the bug fix here: https://crrev.com/c/4916612/1..2



Original commit message:

For real this time. The string used for the feature uses 'R' so updating

the testing config to use that flag.



This causes some tests to fail so fixing some of them and disabling ones

that I couldn't immediately figure out how to fix.

Filed https://crbug.com/1487858 for that follow-up work.



Filed https://crbug.com/1488077 for follow-up work to disable SB

entry.title: Default-initialize all POD fields in commerce_types.h
entry.content:
Among many needlessly sharp edges in C++ is that POD types are left

uninitialized by default. commerce_types.h forgot to initialize most of

its fields and, in several cases was actually accessing them

uninitialized.



In some cases, it happened to work before because absl::optional

would actually zero the storage area for T when initializing to

nullopt. So if an optional began its life as nullopt and then got one

of commerce_types.h's types emplaced into it, the uninitialized fields

would implicitly get set to zero.



This seems to have occurred with MerchantInfo and PriceInsightsInfo:

https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/commerce/core/shopping_service.cc;drc=1d2715064cc686e5eac4e41f34dbc212d47deff1;l=1060

https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/commerce/core/shopping_service.cc;drc=4f1f6200053c99eb6acba86807bd633b4b8cb82a;l=1130



This behavior isn't part of C++ and, notably, libc++ does not do this.

Additionally, were the types initialized on the stack, absl::optional

would not have saved them. Abseil actually tried to remove it for perf

with large types, but had to revert it in cl/245004716. Switching to

libc++'s std::optional removed it and so MSan now caught the bug.



ParcelTrackingStatus and DiscountInfo may have been fine as-is. It's

possible all their users were already manually initializing the fields.

But there is no sense playing with fire, so initialize all their fields

too for safety.



Bug: 1373619

Change-Id: I4edfdfe6f52809e017afbedafde9e5958fb63741

Fixed: 1488730

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4904480

Reviewed-by: David Maunder

Commit-Queue: David Benjamin

Reviewed-by: Ayman Almadhoun

Auto-Submit: David Benjamin

entry.title: Fix RP overlay clipping, and disable RP Transform delegation
entry.content:
Predicting buffer size in the overlay factory is difficult, so

there were bugs when clipping and setting UVs. Use the

old way of baking the clip_rect into the display_rect, and

settings UVs in SkiaRenderer.



Also temporarily disable delegating RPs with matrix

Transforms because accounting for clipping and filters

that expand bounds is more complicated. I'm working on

fixing that in a follow up and re-enabling transform

delgation for RPs.

entry.title: Improve accuracy of JS execution error message.
entry.content:
The existing code will return an error of "Renderer terminated" even

when the actual error is that the underlying RenderFrameHost that was

the target of the JS execution has just been deleted, even though the

renderer process may not have exited. This CL improves the error message by making it specific to the case at hand.



See

https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4856149/comment/10d16b7a_6c018e17/

for where this was discovered.

entry.title: dlp: use FilebackedBlobFactory for local filesystem blobs
entry.content:
If local files are accessed through the Filesystem API on a dlp enabled

system, we need to register the blobs with ExecutionContext to be able

to determine the current URL the same way we use for the File API. This

registration also has to be synchronous as the access policy on blink is

kept in scope only for the call.

entry.title: Revert "[CIC] Account height of content view for omnibox suggestion list"
entry.content:
This reverts commit a3ac64b545154a8dfff89c8334e761f9756fa023.



Reason for revert: Break tests on android-oreo-x86-rel.

Example build: https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/try/android-x86-rel/1650/overview



Original change's description:

> [CIC] Account height of content view for omnibox suggestion list

>

> Omnibox suggestion used to assume that the content view is always at the top of the window in #recalculateOmniboxAlignment. This is not the case on automotive since there's a back button bar on the top.

>

> This CL fix the issue by checking the available space left in window v.s. the size of the content view.

>

> Screenshots for preview see b/290104585#comment12

entry.title: Enable kCdmStorageDatabaseMigration flag by default
entry.content:
This CL enables kCdmStorageDatabaseMigration flag by default. This is so

that when we conduct experiments on the migration, we don't end up using

the CdmStorage* path, and we just turn on the kCdmStorageDatabase flag

to conduct our experiments on the migration.



This is related to this CL in regards to migration: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4874970

entry.title: Extract the drag policy code from the Aura drag-and-drop code and reuse it on the Mac
entry.content:
There's been quite a lot of hardening that was applied to the Aura

drag and drop code that wasn't applied to the Mac version. Extract

Aura's DragStart struct, and code using it, to reuse it for the Mac.

This fixes the issue by reusing the hardening written for the Aura

implementation, and hopefully ensures that in the future, changes

to the hardening will be applied to the Mac's drag and drop code

as well.



Fixed: 1488621

Low-Coverage-Reason: HARD_TO_TEST plus this is a security catchup

entry.title: [Read Aloud] Use language code to filter voices.
entry.content:
The "default" property on SpeechSynthesisVoice doesn't always

return an expected default voice. e.g. on Linux, a Dutch voice is

default, even though the device and browser language are English.



Still attempt to use the default voice from the list of voices in the

language or all the voices if no voices are found in the default

language.



More work will be done on voice / language management, but this

just enables faster development on Linux with an English voice

for now.

entry.content:
This change introduces a new periodic collector for collecting and

reporting website usage telemetry. This will be similar to the one we

had for app usage metrics so we can make an best effort attempt to

enqueue usage telemetry data before it is stale. A similar

implementation for Lacros will follow in a separate CL.

entry.title: events: Allow EventRewriters to copy native_event explicitly
entry.content:
Event::native_event_ is explicitly not copyable on ChromeOS due to the

inability to guarantee that the copied event will have a lifetime that

fits within the lifetime of the original event.



This adds an API for EventRewriters to use to explicitly set

Event::native_event_.

entry.title: [DownloadBubble] Fix icon bugs introduced in crrev.com/c/4904720
entry.content:
This fixes 2 user-visible bugs that regressed in crrev.com/c/4904720.



1. The animated scanning ring for deep scans disappeared. It is restored

by always forcing a redraw of the progress ring if we need to show

the scanning animation.



2. Any update to the progress requiring a redraw of the progress ring

was not processed until the subsequent update call, resulting in an

inconsistent icon state for the first 0.5 seconds. This is fixed by

calling UpdateIcon only after redraw_progress_soon_ is set.



Bug: 1487569

entry.title: [SecureDLs] Treat downloads initiated by opaque origins as secure
entry.content:
This CL adds a carve-out from insecure download blocking for downloads

that are initiated by opaque origins. Opaque origins aren't inherently

trustworthy, but these secure sites often trigger downloads from within

opaque origins to limit the risk of XSS when downloading user-generated

content.



Bug: 1430612, 1485765

entry.title: [win] Fix a typo in HWNDMessageHandler::CenterWindow()
entry.content:
The code is supposed to check the parent window handle, not the window's

handle, and use the owner window handle of the parent window does not

exist.
